Text: We live in a country that lacks universal paid leave and forces working families who are already struggling to go underwater when caring for a sick child or an ailing parent. I can‚Äôt stress this enough‚Äîwe need paid leave now.

This is letting Putin know exactly what the response will be from the transatlantic community if he were to invade: overwhelming, crushing sanctions and an unbreakable commitment to supporting the Ukrainian people through this crisis.

This coordination is resulting in real support for Ukraine: statements that present a strong, united front, more American and European security assistance, training for Ukrainian forces and financial support from the US and EU for Ukraine's economy.

We are seeing non-stop diplomacy in action: American & European leaders taking one trip after another to meet in Kyiv, to meet with Russian counterparts, & to meet and coordinate with each other. This is how we show resolve and come to mutual agreements that help protect Ukraine.

We know that Russia seeks to destabilize Ukraine, divide the United States from its transatlantic allies and disrupt the international world order that is based on sovereignty and the rule of law. So far, @POTUS hasn't let that happen and his hard work is really paying off.

We have an opportunity to demonstrate our values of believing in the collective voice and power of workers. We cannot stop fighting until every worker in the country can form a union, without interference, including our own employees, right here in the Congress of the U.S.

There is no cause for further delay. I urge my colleagues to advocate that this resolution be brought to the House floor as soon as possible. And in the meantime, I hope my colleagues will recognize a union if a majority of their staff indicates they have chosen to form one.

My colleagues and I are listening to the workers and taking this first, critical step to get done what we should have decades ago: recognize congressional workers‚Äô right to organize without fear of retaliation.

Today is about a simple proposition ‚Äì that congressional staff must enjoy the same fundamental rights of freedom of association at work, to organize and bargain collectively for better conditions, that all workers deserve.

Thus far, congressional staff have driven the unionization process‚Äîand they must continue to do so.  Questions surrounding exactly how the unionization process will work are appropriate for another day. üßµhttps://t.co/XCCBMyBKxl

On this International #HolocaustRemembranceDay, let us celebrate the unity and resilience of our communities, as we come together to combat the interwoven forms of hatred that threaten us and build a safer, more compassionate world for all.
We must loudly and consistently call out antisemitism in all its forms.

A school board in Tennessee voted this month to ban the Holocaust book ‚ÄúMAUS‚Äù from their curricula. Less than two weeks ago, Jewish worshippers and a rabbi were held hostage at Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville, Texas during Shabbat services.

Jews across the country have been feeling the palpable fear and trauma that stems from the Tree of Life and Poway synagogue mass shootings and many smaller incidents. During the January 6 insurrection, a rioter was pictured wearing a ‚ÄúCamp Auschwitz‚Äù sweatshirt.

Let us recognize and highlight the alarming rise in antisemitism and antisemitic violence across the United States. According to @AJCGlobal's ‚ÄúState of Antisemitism in America Report,‚Äù almost 4 in 10 American Jews changed their behavior in 2021 out of fear of antisemitism.

At a systemic level, uniting against antisemitism and all forms of hate and intolerance requires combatting supremacist, discriminatory and nationalist ideologies while pursuing a broader vision of equality and justice.

Today, as we remember the Holocaust and reflect on its horrors, it is essential to recommit to the memory of those who perished and move forward with a fervent dedication never to allow our neighbors to be obliterated by otherness. üßµ #HolocaustRemembranceDay

As the students at Oxford High School return bravely to class this week after such a devastating tragedy in our community, it's vital that we provide them with the care and resources they need. Thank you, @GovWhitmer for prioritizing mental health resources for our children.

Are you tuned into @GovWhitmer's State of the State speech? She just unveiled a proposal for a new EV rebate, adding a combined $2,500 at the point-of-sale and for at-home charging. This is exactly what we need to defeat the climate crisis and make EV ownership more accessible.

Thrilled to see that @GovWhitmer is calling on Lansing to repeal the retirement tax while boosting the Earned Income Tax Credit for the middle and working class. It's essential that we cut costs for working families and seniors who are struggling to recover from this pandemic.

Lowering prescription drug costs, capping the price of insulin and holding Big Pharma accountable are initiatives that I am fighting for every day in Congress. I am beyond grateful that we have a leader like @GovWhitmer to make this a priority in our state, as well.

For years, @GovWhitmer has been fighting to ‚Äúfix the damn roads.‚Äù I was proud to help secure the federal funding needed here in Michigan to rebuild our roads and bridges while creating good-paying, union jobs and investing in climate resilient infrastructure.
